verses.plain: Why standest thou afar off, O LORD? why hidest thou thyself in times of trouble?

tokens.t: Why standest thou afar off, O
hidest thou
in times of trouble?

verses.plain: The wicked in his pride doth persecute the poor: let them be taken in the devices that they have imagined.

tokens.t: The wicked in
pride doth persecute the poor: let them be taken in the devices that they have imagined.

verses.plain: For the wicked boasteth of his heart’s desire, and blesseth the covetous, whom the LORD abhorreth.

tokens.t: For the wicked boasteth of his heart’s desire, and blesseth the covetous,
the
abhorreth.

verses.plain: The wicked, through the pride of his countenance, will not seek after God: God is not in all his thoughts.

tokens.t: The wicked, through the pride of his countenance, will not seek
God
not in all his thoughts.

verses.plain: His ways are always grievous; thy judgments are far above out of his sight: as for all his enemies, he puffeth at them.

tokens.t: His ways are always grievous; thy judgments
far above out of his sight:
all his enemies, he puffeth at them.

verses.plain: He hath said in his heart, I shall not be moved: for I shall never be in adversity.

tokens.t: He hath said in his heart, I shall not be moved: for
never
in adversity.

verses.plain: His mouth is full of cursing and deceit and fraud: under his tongue is mischief and vanity.

tokens.t: His mouth is full of cursing and deceit and fraud: under his tongue
mischief and vanity.

verses.plain: He sitteth in the lurking places of the villages: in the secret places doth he murder the innocent: his eyes are privily set against the poor.

tokens.t: He sitteth in the lurking places of the villages: in the secret places doth he murder the innocent: his eyes are privily set against the poor.

verses.plain: He lieth in wait secretly as a lion in his den: he lieth in wait to catch the poor: he doth catch the poor, when he draweth him into his net.

tokens.t: He lieth in wait secretly as a lion in his den: he lieth in wait to catch the poor: he doth catch the poor, when he draweth him into his net.

verses.plain: He croucheth, and humbleth himself, that the poor may fall by his strong ones.

tokens.t: He croucheth,
humbleth himself, that the poor may fall by his strong ones.

verses.plain: He hath said in his heart, God hath forgotten: he hideth his face; he will never see it.

tokens.t: He hath said in his heart, God hath forgotten: he hideth his face; he will never see

verses.plain: Arise, O LORD; O God, lift up thine hand: forget not the humble.

tokens.t: Arise, O
; O God, lift up thine hand: forget not the humble.

verses.plain: Wherefore doth the wicked contemn God? he hath said in his heart, Thou wilt not require it.

tokens.t: Wherefore doth the wicked contemn God? he hath said in his heart, Thou wilt not require

verses.plain: Thou hast seen it; for thou beholdest mischief and spite, to requite it with thy hand: the poor committeth himself unto thee; thou art the helper of the fatherless.

tokens.t: Thou hast seen
for thou beholdest mischief and spite, to requite
with thy hand: the poor committeth himself unto thee; thou art the helper of the fatherless.

verses.plain: Break thou the arm of the wicked and the evil man: seek out his wickedness till thou find none.

tokens.t: Break thou the arm of the wicked and the evil
seek out his wickedness
thou find none.

verses.plain: The LORD is King for ever and ever: the heathen are perished out of his land.

tokens.t: The
King for ever and ever: the heathen are perished out of his land.

verses.plain: LORD, thou hast heard the desire of the humble: thou wilt prepare their heart, thou wilt cause thine ear to hear:

tokens.t: , thou hast heard the desire of the humble: thou wilt prepare their heart, thou wilt cause thine ear to hear:

verses.plain: To judge the fatherless and the oppressed, that the man of the earth may no more oppress.

tokens.t: To judge the fatherless and the oppressed, that the man of the earth may no more oppress.

footnotes.text: The wicked…: Heb. In the pride of the wicked he doth persecute
blesseth…: or, the covetous blesseth himself, he abhorreth the LORD
God is…: or, all his thoughts are, There is no God
never: Heb. unto generation and generation
secretly: Heb. in the secret places
by…: or, into his strong parts
